column4: I'm trying to transfer files from my laptop to my server over ssh, but I can't seem to get the permissions right.  Can someone help me out?
the -p option to scp preserves file perms, is that what you need?
I don't think so.  Even with the -p option, I get a "Permission denied" message
Then the files at the remote end are probably not wrteable by you and you are trying to overwrite them?
You may need to set them 644 (and directories to 755) before doing the scp
How do I do that?
Do you have ssh shell access to the remote server?
Yes.
Then ssh in there and use chmod 0644 somefile, or chmod 644 * or whatever is appropriate
or just delete the old files using rm
Cool, thanks
No Problem.
Even after using chmod, I still get a "Permission denied" message: http://paste.ubuntu.com/28882/
does the user michael own the file /var/www/index.html ?
If you want to you can try rm /var/www/index.html in the ssh shell first?
I tried the rm command and I'm still denied permission
Then that's not your file.  Do you have root on the remote server?
I think so?
This is not a ssh or scp issue at all, just a basic Unix/Linxu file permissions thing.
Not entirely sure
So become root on the remote machine and then rm that file.
